ranked_diseases.explanation: Patient presents with all three core features seen in RP11 from Case 2: reduced visual acuity, abnormal ERG, and retinal pigment epithelial changes. Age of presentation (26Y) is consistent with typical RP onset.

Shows 3/4 features from Case 1 (reduced visual acuity, abnormal ERG, retinal pigment epithelial mottling). However, lacks nystagmus and severe visual reduction, and LCA typically presents in infancy, not at 26 years.
Common cause of juvenile/young adult macular dystrophy with reduced visual acuity and retinal pigment changes. ERG abnormalities can occur in advanced cases. Age of presentation fits well.
Presents with reduced visual acuity and abnormal ERG. Retinal pigment epithelial changes are common. Typically manifests in young adulthood, consistent with patient's age.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Pattern dystrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium
ranked_diseases.explanation: Characterized by retinal pigment epithelial mottling and mild visual acuity reduction. ERG is often normal but can show mild abnormalities. Adult onset fits patient's age.
